turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Why do you stare at me like that?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: You remind me of someone I used to know.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I don't have any answers for you.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Who was that man last night?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Then how did he know your name?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Do you always walk around with a sword?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: New York is dangerous place.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You talk to me -- but you don't answer my questions.  I guess I'll have to talk to Lieutenant Bedsoe.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: It probably wouldn't interest you. It's something I read in a mythology book.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I'm interested in mythology.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Have you ever heard of the Calan?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You look like you have.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Meet me Tratino's at nine.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I told you I'm interested in mythology.  We can talk about it more.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Good evening.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You're twenty minutes late.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You didn't answer my question.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You have an interesting accent. Where are you from?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I'm just trying to place you.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I've lived all over the world.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You're not an easy person to get to know.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Why?  Because I don't give up all my secrets?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: How come you wanted to meet tonight?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I wanted to get to know you better.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: That makes you uncomfortable?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: A little -- yes.  My interest in coming here is profession.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Is it?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Yes -- it is.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Alright.  In the shop you mentioned something about--

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: --the Calan.  Do you know who they are?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Why don't you tell me.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Have you told Lieutenant Bedsoe your theory?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Because I don't feel like sitting in a rubber room for forty-eight hours.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: You don't really believe this do you?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Let me ask you something else.  At the excavation site in Scotland, the tunnel leading into the cavern had collapsed.  The day we found the body someone had moved the rocks, making a hole in the collapsed section.  What bothers me is that we found the rocks from the hole on our side of the tunnel wall.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Why would someone pull on the rocks to get in the cavern?  They were wedged in tight.  They couldn't get a grip on them.  They would have had much more strength pushing on them.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: If they pushed the rocks you would have found them on the other side of the cavern wall.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Yes -- if they were trying to get in -- but what if they weren't?  What if they were trying to get out?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: That would mean they'd been trapped in there--

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: --for three hundred years.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: How could that be?  People don't live for three hundred years.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Not unless they're immortal.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Would you like to see it?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I've seen it.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: On the back it has--

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: --the crest of a lion and a dragon and a single word:  Courage.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: How did you know that?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: It came from your great, great, great grandmother, Isabelle Tourez, who lived in Paris and died on the guillotine in 1789 -- alone -- and unmarried.  The ring was given to her by someone who loved her -- but knew that it could never be.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: You wanted the truth -- now you have it.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: And the other one -- he is like you?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: He is immortal -- yes -- but he is not like me.  We are the last of our kind.  The last of the Calans.  I do not know what purpose we were put here for.  I only know that if he wins the world will suffer for it.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Where will you go now?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: It will end tonight.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Must you fight him?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: He will not stop until it is over.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: He's in there!

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Be careful, Conner.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Conner?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What now?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Now I can start to live.  To feel. To grow old and live each day without the promise of another.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Sounds very -- normal.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: Just a little.  Who knows what we're going to find in there.  It could be a huge excavation.  A little friendly PR never hurt.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Where is the film crew from the British Museum?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: They've had a little car trouble. I'm afraid they won't be here until after dark.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Then we shouldn't break into the cavern until tomorrow morning.  This could be a very important find.  I want it documented.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: We're holding the workers down below.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Someone broke into the cavern last night.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: What?  How?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: He's fine.  He swears he never left his post for a moment.  He heard a noise and when he went back to look they were already inside.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: How could they get by him?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: We found him this morning.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: What's that next to him?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: His head.  Someone cut it off.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: Incredible.  The cloth -- the buttons -- it looks to be mid sixteen hundreds.  It's a remarkable duplication.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I don't think it is a duplication.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: It has to be.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: And this?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: You stayed here again last night?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I was working on the cataloging.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: Jennifer, there is more to life than work.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I know, Paul.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: Do you?  Then why don't you go out? Meet someone.  Make a life for yourself instead of hiding away in the past?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I like my work.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR DAJORSKI
turns.text: I'm having some people over tonight for dinner -- I'd like you come.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: We'll see.

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: It flatters me you remember, old one. It's been what... two hundred years?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: It's not been long enough.  What witchcraft is this?

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: Impressive -- is it not?  The problem is I can only keep the illusion for a few minutes.  I need more power to hold the form longer.  I need the Highlander.  Where is he?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: I do not know -- and even if I did...

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: I know.  I know-- you would not tell me.  Loyalty -- it really is a concept that eludes me.  Oh well -- I shall find him.  Time is on my side.

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: Oh -- I almost forgot.  Your head.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: It does not come off as easily as the young ones.

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: Perhaps -- but it comes off none the less.

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: Highlander -- I had hoped it would be you.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: This cannot be.

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: I am stronger than you, Highlander.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: That's what the Kurgan said.

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: The Kurgan was a pussy.

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: Fine -- I've waited over three centuries.  I can wait a little longer.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Why did you wait?

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: It was not by choice.  A small matter of a mountain falling down on us.  We were trapped inside.  When the time of the Gathering came the urge to go was so strong we tried to claw through rock with our bare hands.  What you thought was the end -- was not.  This is the end.  We are the last of our kind, Macleod.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: It will not end tonight.

turns.speaker: KILVARA
turns.text: You cannot hide from me.  You will not stand between me and my destiny. After I have your head the power will let me hold any form as long as I want.  Do you know what that means? I can become the President -- I can become anyone I want.  The world will be mine.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You know it's not safe here for you.

turns.speaker: MACLEOD
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: The police still have a lot of questions for Russell Nash.

turns.speaker: MACLEOD
turns.text: I can take care of myself.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: It isn't over, is it, Conner?

turns.speaker: MACLEOD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: How can that be?

turns.speaker: MACLEOD
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Is there anything else you need?

turns.speaker: MACLEOD
turns.text: No -- I'm fine.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I'm glad you've come home, Conner.

turns.speaker: MACLEOD
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Would you care for some water, Conner?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Aye -- that I would, lass.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Don't leave us, Conner.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: It's not for me to decide.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Don't cry, wee one.  It's a better place I go to.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I love you, Conner.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Aye -- I know, Las -- and I have never loved anyone more.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'll no forget you.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: And I you.  Go now.  Let me walk to heavens door alone.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: You kept it?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I shouldn't have come back here.  It was a mistake.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Is it a mistake for someone to go to the ones who love them when they're in trouble?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Yes -- when their troubles can harm them.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Why won't you ever let anyone help you?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I heard voices downstairs.  Is everything alright?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What will you do?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: There's nothing I can do.  I'll wait. One way or another soon it will all be over soon.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I could have ended it tonight, but I didn't.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I don't know.  He is the stronger one.  He has a power--

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You also have a power, Conner.  It is why you have survived.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Do not underestimate the power of your heart.  Your dreams live there.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: My dreams died long ago.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Did they?  You are only a man, different than most -- but still a man.  You feel the same -- want the same.  You want to live.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: I haven't lived life -- I've hidden from it.  I've existed in the shadows.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: And now it's time to come out of the shadows.

turns.speaker: MCCLEOD
turns.text: Dear, sweet, Rachel.  Men's lifes are measured by the good they do.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: If you search your heart you know all the good you have done.  Your strength comes from your heart -- because in your heart you know what you are fighting for is good and just.  This room is filled with memories. If you search through them you can find the good -- the difference you have made.  And now, it is for you to make the greatest difference of all. Look in your heart, Conner -- and you will see the good that you have done.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: Good afternoon, Mr. Parker.

turns.speaker: MR. PARKER
turns.text: Good afternoon...  ... Shirley.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: Would you like to deposit this in your account?

turns.speaker: MR. PARKER
turns.text: No.  The money, please.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: This check is for sixteen thousand dollars.  That's a lot of cash to be carrying around.

turns.speaker: MR. PARKER
turns.text: I can take care of myself.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: Alright.  It's going to take a few minutes.  I have to call and verify the funds.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Mike!  Mike, can you hear me?

turns.speaker: ANDERS
turns.text: I think he's dead!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Don't shout, Larry.  I'm three feet away.

turns.speaker: ANDERS
turns.text: The house belongs to Walter and Pamela Smith.  They've got two kids, a girl about fifteen and a boy younger, Jennifer and Thomas.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: That would be the girl who opened the door.  Are the others inside?

turns.speaker: ANDERS
turns.text: The mother is in Florida visiting her sister.  The father works at home, so he's probably inside.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Call the Palmdale City Attorney for a telephonic search warrant.  When you get the warrant, have Mikkelson and Dreyer search his house.

turns.speaker: ANDERS
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: ANDERS
turns.text: Wow.  Sure, right away, Chief.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Don't tell anyone what you're doing, not Louise, not the other guys, not the Sheriffs.  You understand me, Larry?

turns.speaker: ANDERS
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Fuck guessing.  You keep your mouth shut.

turns.speaker: ANDERS
turns.text: I will, Chief.  Absolutely.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Get to work.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Talley.

turns.speaker: ANDERS' VOICE
turns.text: It's me, Chief.  Can you talk?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: What'd you find out?

turns.speaker: ANDERS' VOICE
turns.text: The cell phone is registered to a jewelry store in Beverly Hills.  The phone company shows no unusual --

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Dead end--it's a clone.  What about the Mustang?

turns.speaker: ANDERS' VOICE
turns.text: It was stolen.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You get anything on Smith?

turns.speaker: ANDERS' VOICE
turns.text: Chief...it's like none of this exists. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Keep trying.

turns.speaker: BELDONE
turns.text: The house is in flames, Benza's accountant is with the cops, and they're stacking the bodies like cordwood.

turns.speaker: CASTELLANO
turns.text: Jesus Christ, it's a clusterfuck.

turns.speaker: BELDONE
turns.text: You wanted to let Sonny handle it.  I would've moved in when we first found out.

turns.speaker: CASTELLANO
turns.text: And by doing so, he would've known we have spies in his organization.

turns.speaker: BELDONE
turns.text: Yes, sir.  But what about the disks?  If the cops end up with the disks, we're gonna see a whole lot of heat.

turns.speaker: CASTELLANO
turns.text: I hate that Mickey Mouse bastard.  I hated his father, and I hate Sonny, too. Always with the tan.

turns.speaker: BELDONE
turns.text: What do you want to do?

turns.speaker: CASTELLANO
turns.text: Our people out there, they good people? People in the right place?

turns.speaker: BELDONE
turns.text: The best.

turns.speaker: CASTELLANO
turns.text: Sonny's a fuckup.  If he pulls this off, fine--life goes on.  But if the cops end up with those disks, we cut our losses.

turns.speaker: BELDONE
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: CASTELLANO
turns.text: I want a message sent:  No fuckups allowed.

turns.speaker: BELDONE
turns.text: I'll make the call.

turns.speaker: TUZEE
turns.text: Worst case, it's a bloodbath.  The detectives come out with Smith's computer, and we go directly to jail, do not pass Go.

turns.speaker: BENZA
turns.text: Maybe Glen already picked up the disks.

turns.speaker: TUZEE
turns.text: I took the call from Glen personally. They're still in Smith's house.

turns.speaker: TUZEE
turns.text: You should warn them, Sonny.

turns.speaker: BENZA
turns.text: <u>Fuck</u> them!  Now get your head in the game, Phil--we have to handle this.

turns.speaker: BENZA
turns.text: Put our people on the scene.  Smith might talk just to cut a break for his kids.

turns.speaker: TUZEE
turns.text: He knows better than that.

turns.speaker: BENZA
turns.text: Bullshit--a man will do anything to save his family.  Who's running the show up there?

turns.speaker: BENZA
turns.text: Find out how we can hurt him.  By the end of the day, I want to own him.

turns.speaker: TUZEE
turns.text: It's happening right now.

turns.speaker: FISCHER
turns.text: Maybe we're getting too dramatic.  It's three kids.  They'll give up, the cops will arrest them, and that's that.  Why would they search the house?

turns.speaker: BENZA
turns.text: You think we should take that chance?

turns.speaker: FISCHER
turns.text: I guess not.

turns.speaker: BENZA
turns.text: I guess not, too.  How much information is in the house?

turns.speaker: BENZA
turns.text: What, he's cute?  That's his idea of humor?

turns.speaker: FISCHER
turns.text: If the Feds get those disks, the East Coast is gonna take a hit, too.  You should let them know.

turns.speaker: BENZA
turns.text: No way.  I tell them, that Old Man is gonna handle this from back there.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Jen?  Are you all right?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: She'll be dead if you don't put your ass in that chair!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Who sent you?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Don't go Rambo and you'll tell'm about this on the back nine.  I'm gonna tie you up, then we're gonna take your car.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: The car.  All you want is the car?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Am I talkin' raghead?!  I want your car! <u>Gimme the goddamned keys</u>!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Stay down!  Stay <u>down</u>, goddamnit!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm going to my desk.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You're not goin' anywhere!  Get on the fuckin' floor!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: <u>Get on the floor</u>!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I have contacts in Los Angeles.  Lawyers and judges who can help you.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Mars, watch the cops!  Kevin!  Watch the back of the house!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You won't die if you let me help.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Bullshit!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: But if you stay in this house, I can promise you this --

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: <u>Shut up!  Shut up and get on the floor</u>!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You can't imagine the fucking you're going to get.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: C'mon, Dennis, this is stupid.  I thought we were gonna go to the movies.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Mars?!  Whattaya think, dude?  Out here on the edge, no one around, it's perfect, right?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Try to act cool, okay?  He's gonna think you're a dick.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Robbing this place is gonna put you back in prison.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Not if they don't catch us, Kevin.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: We got jobs, man; we're working.  Why even take the chance?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Because if you don't take the chance, you're already dead.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: There's fuckin' blood all over you!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: I didn't know he would have a gun!  It just went off!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: That woman's gonna call the cops.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Shut up, goddamnit!  Just calm down!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: What if he's dead?  What if you killed him?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: That's why we gotta keep going.  I'm not gonna go in for murder.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: We're on foot.  We can't get away.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: We're surrounded by houses, dumbass. Every house has a car in the garage. All we have to do is take one.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: We could've gone out the back!  You didn't have to shoot!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Stop it!  They found the truck, Kev! They're already behind us!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: We should give up.  All we're doing is making it worse.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I have to tell you something --

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: We gotta find a way outta here is what we gotta do!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: It's about Mars --

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: That cop didn't pull his gun.  Mars lied. He just started shooting!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Bullshit.  Why would Mars do that?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I was <u>there</u>, Dennis!  I <u>saw</u>!  It's like he <u>wanted</u> to shoot that cop.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You're being stupid.  Check out the bathroom.  Maybe we can sneak out a window --

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Jesus.  What is this?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Are you totally stupid?  What does it look like?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Everyone knows what we look like, Dennis. We won't be able to hide.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Jesus, first Mars, now you.  You two need anti-depressants.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Someone should stay with Mr. Smith.  What if he wakes up?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: That's why we tied him, dumbass.  Now come here and see this --

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: These bushes follow the wall into the neighbor's yard.  All we need is some kind of diversion and we're home free.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: That's crazy, Dennis.  The cops will see us.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Not if they're looking at something else.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: We can't carry all this.  It's too heavy.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: I've been carrying you our whole fuckin' lives.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: We're fucked.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: We're fucked until we think of a way out; then we're rich.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: There is no way out.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: For chrissake, <u>please</u>!  Help me celebrate!  I figured it out!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Celebrate what?  Going to prison?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: If we don't escape, we gotta get the word out about the cash.  That's how we'll stay alive.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: The only way he can keep the cash is if nobody knows about it.  He's gotta cap all three of us before they even read our rights.  He's probably planning it right now.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: That's crazy.  He's not going to kill us.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Kevin, you're so fuckin' stupid...

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: It's over.  We have to give up.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Fuck it's over.  That money's mine.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: That money's fucked up your brain. Talley's going to get tired of waiting for us to give up, and we'll all be fuckin' killed!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Then we might as well die rich.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I'm not going to die for this!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You with the cops?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: The Bristo Police Department.  Look out the window.  You see the car?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Yeah.  I'm Rooney.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: We had an awful lot of shooting.  You need a doctor in there?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: We're cool.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Let me speak to Mr. Smith.  I want to hear it from him.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Fuck you.  I'm running this shit.  You talk to me.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: How about your two friends?  You don't have a man dying in there, do you?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: They're fine.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: All three subjects are confirmed inside. Call off the house-to-house.  Okay, Dennis, I want to explain your situation --

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You don't have to explain shit!  That Chinaman pulled a gun.  We wrestled for it.  That Chinaman shot himself.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Mr. Kim didn't make it, Dennis.  He died.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: How about the cop?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Dennis?  I want you to release those people.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Fuck that.  They're the only thing stopping you from blowing us away.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: We're not coming in there by force, okay? No one wants to hurt you.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: I got these people!  You try to come get me, I'll kill every fuckin' one of them!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: It's over now, Dennis!  Don't hurt anyone.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: We'll burn this fuckin' place down!  I got gasoline all over in here!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Talley?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: I want a helicopter to take us to Mexico.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: That's not going to happen, Dennis.  They won't give you a helicopter.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: I'll give you these people.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: The Mexican police would arrest you as soon as it landed.  There's only one way out and you're doing it right now--just keep talking to us.  I think we could make the transition now. Maddox, you good to go?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Hey, Dennis?  Can I let you in on a personal secret?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I gotta piss real bad.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You're a funny guy, Talley.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'm going to put on an officer named Will Maddox.  You talk to him for a while.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: That you, Talley?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: The one and only.  We got a little problem out here, Dennis.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You oughta try on the problem I got in here.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I need you to let me talk to Mr. Smith.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: We been through that.  Forget it.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: We can't forget it.  The Sheriffs think you won't let me talk to Smith because he's dead.  They think you murdered him.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Now I understand.  That helps.  I can make them understand that.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Let me come get him.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Fuck that!  You bastards will jump me!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: If you won't let me come in, then put him outside.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You'll cap my ass as soon as I step out the door!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You've already helped yourself once, Dennis; be smart again.  If you save his life, it'll help when you get to court.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You got a sniper out there, gonna shoot me?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Only if you try to grab me.  We could've shot you from the wall.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You've been in there a long time. What're you waiting for?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Would you be in a hurry to go to prison for the rest of your life?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'd be trying to get the best deal that I could.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Maybe that's what I'm doing.  Can I reach in my pocket, show you something?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You picked a bad house to hole up in, son.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Two hundred thousand cash, right in your pocket, no one needs to know.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Give up.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: There's a million dollars in there, maybe <u>two</u> million.  I'll give you half.
